docs.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW--Although "the pill" has become the favorite method of birth control in many advanced countries, it is still frowned upon by health officials gin the Soviet Union. They feel that intrauterine devices are safer, at least for the present.

headline.main: Medicine; How the Russians Deal With Birth Control

docs.abstract: W Sullivan article discusses new abortion technique used in USSR in 1st 3 mos of pregnancy
docs.snippet: MOSCOW--Although "the pill" has become the favorite method of birth control in many advanced countries, it is still frowned upon by health officials gin the Soviet Union. They feel that intrauterine devices are safer, at least for the present.
